summary.long: 1 Chronicles is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: Adam, Seth, Enosh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Noah.
The sons of Noah were Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshek, and Tiras.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Diphath, and Togarmah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Javan were Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittim, and the Rodanim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ham were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Ra’ama, and Sabteca.
The sons of Ra’ama were Sheba and Dedan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cush became the father of Nimrod. Nimrod was the first to be a mighty warrior on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mizraim became the father of the Ludim, the Anamim, the Lehabim, the Naphtuhim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Pathrusim, the Casluhim (from whom the Philistines came), and the Caphtorim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canaan became the father of Sidon, his firstborn, and of Heth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also of the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram.
        The sons of Aram were Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arphaxad became the father of Shelah, and Shelah became the father of Eber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two sons were born to Eber. The name of one was Peleg, because in his days the earth was divided. His brother’s name was Joktan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joktan became the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ebal, Abimael, Sheba,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eber, Peleg, Reu,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Serug, Nahor, Terah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abram (also called Abraham).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Abraham were Isaac and Ishmael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These are their genealogies:
The firstborn of Ishmael was Nebaioth. Then came Kedar, Adbe’el, Mibsam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These are the sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine. She gave birth to Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.
The sons of Jokshan were Sheba and Dedan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Hanok, Abida, and Elda’ah.
All these were the descendants of Keturah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Abraham became the father of Isaac.
The sons of Isaac were Esau and Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Esau were Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, Kenaz, and Amalek by Timna.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Reuel were Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Seir were Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Lotan were Hori and Homam. Timna was Lotan’s sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shobal were Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam.
        The sons of Zibeon were Aiah and Anah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Anah was Dishon.
        The sons of Dishon were Hamran, Eshban, Ithran, and Keran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ezer were Bilhan, Za’avan, and Ja’akan.
    The sons of Dishan were Uz and Aran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the people of Israel:
Bela son of Beor. The name of his city was Dinhabah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bela died, and Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah reigned as king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jobab died, and Husham from the land of the Temanites reigned as king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Husham died, and Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the territory of Moab, reigned as king in his place. The name of his city was Avith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hadad died, and Samlah from Masrekah reigned as king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Samlah died, and Shaul from Rehoboth by the River reigned as king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shaul died, and Baal Hanan son of Akbor reigned as king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Baal Hanan died, and Hadad reigned as king in his place. The name of his city was Pai, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me Zahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Hadad died.
The chiefs of Edom were Chief Timna, Chief Aliah, Chief Jetheth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Chief Oholibamah, Chief Elah, Chief Pinon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Chief Kenaz, Chief Teman, Chief Mibzar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Chief Magdiel, and Chief Iram. These are the chiefs of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Judah were Er, Onan, and Shelah. Those three were born to him by Shua’s daughter, a Canaanite woman. Er, who was Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the Lord, so he killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tamar, Judah’s daughter-in-law, gave birth to Perez and Zerah for him. Judah had a total of five sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Zerah were Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Kalkol, and Dara, five
of them in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Carmi was Achar, the troubler of Israel, who was unfaithful when he stole things that had been devoted to destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Ethan was Azariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Hezron, who were born to him, were Jerahme’el, Ram, and Celubai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ram became the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, the tribal leader of the people of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nahshon became the father of Salma, and Salma became the father of Boaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Boaz became the father of Obed, and Obed became the father of Jesse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesse became the father of his firstborn Eliab, Abinadab his second, Shimea his third,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nethanel his fourth, Raddai his fifth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ozem his sixth, and David his seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. The three sons of Zeruiah were Abishai, Joab, and Asahel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abigail gave birth to Amasa, and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caleb the son of Hezron became the father of children by Azubah his wife, also known as Jerioth. These were her sons: Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azubah died, and Caleb married Ephrath, who gave birth to Hur for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hur became the father of Uri, and Uri became the father of Bezalel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward, Hezron went to the daughter of Makir, the father of Gilead, whom he took when he was sixty years old, and she gave birth to Segub for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Segub became the father of Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Geshur and Aram took the towns of Jair from them, along with Kenath and its villages, sixty cities in all. All these were the sons of Makir, the father of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Hezron died in Caleb Ephrathah, Abijah, Hezron’s wife, gave birth to Ashhur, the father of Tekoa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jerahme’el, the firstborn son of Hezron, were Ram his firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerahme’el had another wife, whose name was Atarah. She was the mother of Onam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ram, the firstborn of Jerahme’el, were Ma’az, Jamin, and Eker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Onam were Shammai and Jada.
The sons of Shammai were Nadab and Abishur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of Abishur’s wife was Abihail, and she gave birth to Ahban and Molid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Nadab were Seled and Appaim, but Seled died without children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Appaim was Ishi.
    The son of Ishi was Sheshan.
    The son of Sheshan was Ahlai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Jada, the brother of Shammai, were Jether and Jonathan.
    Jether died without children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Jonathan were Peleth and Zaza.
These were the descendants of Jerahme’el.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Sheshan had no sons, but only daughters. Sheshan had an Egyptian servant, whose name was Jarha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sheshan gave his daughter to his servant Jarha as a wife, and she gave birth to Attai for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Attai became the father of Nathan, and Nathan became the father of Zabad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Zabad became the father of Ephlal, and Ephlal became the father of Obed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Obed became the father of Jehu, and Jehu became the father of Azariah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Azariah became the father of Helez, and Helez became the father of Eleasah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Eleasah became the father of Sismai, and Sismai became the father of Shallum,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Shallum became the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah became the father of Elishama.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Caleb, the brother of Jerahme’el, were his firstborn son Mesha, who was the father of Ziph, and his son Mareshah, the father of Hebron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Hebron were Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shema became the father of Raham, the father of Jorkeam.
        Rekem became the father of Shammai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Beth Zur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ephah, Caleb’s concubine, gave birth to Haran, Moza, and Gazez. Haran became the father of Gazez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jahdai were Regem, Jothan, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Sha’aph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ma’akah, Caleb’s concubine, gave birth to Sheber and Tirhanah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She also gave birth to Sha’aph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Makbenah and the father of Gibea. Caleb’s daughter was Aksah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the descendants of Caleb, who were the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Salma the father of Bethlehem,
and Hareph the father of Beth Gader.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shobal, the father of Kiriath Jearim, had sons: Haroeh, half of the Menuhoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The families of Kiriath Jearim were the Ithrites, the Puthites, the Shumathites, and the Mishraites. From them came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Salma were Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, half of the Manahathites, and the Zorathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The families of scribes who lived at Jabez were the Tirathites, the
Shimeathites, and the Sukathites. These are the Kenites who came
from Hammath, the father of the house of Rekab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these were the sons of David who were born for him in Hebron: the firstborn, Amnon, whose mother was Ahinoam from Jezre’el, the second, Daniel, whose mother was Abigail from Carmel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the third, Absalom, whose mother was Ma’akah, the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur, the fourth, Adonijah, whose mother was Haggith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fifth, Shephatiah, whose mother was Abital, the sixth, Ithream, whose mother was David’s wife Eglah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So there were six sons born to David in Hebron, and he ruled as king there for seven years and six months.
David ruled as king for thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These sons were born to him in Jerusalem:
four sons of Bathshua the daughter of Ammiel: Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nine other sons: Ibhar, Elishama, Eliphelet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were the sons of David. In addition, there were the sons of the concubines, and Tamar was their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Solomon’s son was Rehoboam,
Abijah was his son,
Asa was his son,
Jehoshaphat was his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joram was his son,
Ahaziah was his son,
Joash was his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Amaziah was his son,
Azariah was his son,
Jotham was his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ahaz was his son,
Hezekiah was his son,
Manasseh was his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Amon was his son,
and Josiah was his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Josiah were his firstborn Johanan, his second Jehoiakim, his third Zedekiah, and his fourth Shallum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jehoiakim were his son Jeconiah and his son Zedekiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jeconiah the captive were Shealtiel his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also Malkiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Pedaiah were Zerubbabel and Shimei.
The sons of Zerubbabel were Meshullam and Hananiah. Shelomith was their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also five others: Hashubah, Ohel, Berekiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab Hesed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Hananiah were Pelatiah and Jeshaiah as well as the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, and the sons of Shekaniah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shekaniah were Shemaiah, Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat, six in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Neariah were Elioenai, Hizkiah, and Azrikam, three in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Elioenai were Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani, seven in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Judah were Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reaiah son of Shobal became the father of Jahath, and Jahath became the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These are the clans of the Zorathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the sons of Etam: Jezre’el, Ishma, and Idbash. The name of their sister was Hazzelelponi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer was the father of Hushah. These are the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, the father of Bethlehem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ashhur, the father of Tekoa, had two wives, Helah and Na’arah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Na’arah gave birth to Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Ha’ahashtari. These were the sons of Na’arah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Helah were Zereth, Izhar, and Ethnan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Koz became the father of Anub, Zobebah, and the clans of Aharhel, the son of Harum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jabez was more honorable than his brothers. His mother named him Jabez because she said, “I gave birth to him with pain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jabez called to the God of Israel, saying, “Oh that you would bless me and enlarge my borders! Let your hand be with me, and keep me from evil, so that I will not experience pain!” God granted him what he requested.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kelub, the brother of Shuhah, became the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eshton became the father of Beth Rapha and Paseah and Tehinnah, the father of Ir Nahash. These are the men of Rekah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Kenaz were Othniel and Seraiah. The sons of Othniel were Hathath and Meonothai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meonothai became the father of Ophrah, and Seraiah became the father of Joab, who was the father of Ge Harashim, because they were craftsmen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Caleb son of Jephunneh were Iru, Elah, and Na’am.
The son of Elah was Kenaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jehallelel were Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ezrah were Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon. Mered’s wife gave birth to Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah, the father of Eshtemoa. These are the sons of Bithiah, the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His Judean wife gave birth to Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Soko, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Hodiah’s wife, who was the sister of Naham, were the fathers of Keilah the Garmite and Eshtemoa the Ma’akathite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shimon were Amnon, Rinnah, Ben Hanan, and Tilon.
The sons of Ishi were Zoheth and Ben Zoheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shelah, the son of Judah, were Er the father of Lekah, La’adah the father of Mareshah, and the families of the house of those who worked fine linen at Beth Ashbea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also Jokim and the men of Kozeba, also Joash and Saraph, who were rulers in Moab, and Jashubi Lehem. These records are ancient.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the potters and the inhabitants of Netaim and Gederah. They lived there with the king, to work for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Simeon were Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, and Shaul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shallum was Shaul’s son, Mibsam his son, and Mishma his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The family line of Mishma was Hammuel his son, Zakkur his son, and Shimei his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters, but his brothers did not have many children, and their whole family did not increase in number like the people of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They lived at Beersheba, Moladah, and Hazar Shual,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at Bilhah, at Ezem, at Tolad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at Bethuel, at Hormah, at Ziklag,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at Beth Markaboth, at Hazar Susim, at Beth Biri, and at Sha’araim. These were their cities until David’s reign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their villages were around Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Token, and Ashan—five cities
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all their villages that were around these cities, as far as Baal. These were their settlements, and they had preserved their genealogical records.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meshobab, Jamlek, and Joshah the son of Amaziah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joel and Jehu the son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elioenai, Ja’akobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, and Benaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: these mentioned by name were leaders in their clans. Their fathers’ houses increased greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went to the entrance of Gedor, to the east side of the valley, to search for pasture for their flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They found good, rich pasture, and the land was spacious, quiet, and peaceful. The people who had lived there previously were descended from Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These who have been named came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah and attacked the tent camps of the Hamites. They completely destroyed the Meunites who were found there, and to this day they have lived in their place, because there was pasture for their flocks there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them, five hundred men, also descendants of Simeon, went to Mount Seir. Their leaders were Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They struck down the remaining Amalekites who had escaped, and they have lived there to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel:
(Though Reuben was the firstborn, because he defiled his father’s bed, his rights as firstborn were given to the sons of Israel’s son Joseph. So Reuben is not treated as firstborn in the genealogical records.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though Judah achieved superiority over his brothers and the ruler came from him, the birthright was Joseph’s.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel, were Hanok, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Successive generations of descendants of Joel were his son Shemaiah, his son Gog, his son Shimei,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his son Micah, his son Reaiah, his son Baal,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his son Be’erah, whom Tiglath Pileser king of Assyria carried away captive. He was the tribal leader of the Reubenites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The following are his relatives as listed by their clans in the genealogical records. Jeiel was the head. Others were Zechariah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bela son of Azaz, who was the son of Shema, who was the son of Joel, who lived in the territory of Aroer, all the way to Nebo and Baal Meon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They lived in the east, all the way to the beginning of the wilderness which extends to the Euphrates River, because their livestock had increased greatly in the land of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the days of Saul, they made war against the Hagraites, who fell by their hand. So they lived in their tents throughout all the land east of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Gad lived next to them in the land of Bashan, all the way to Salekah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joel was the head, Shapham the second, also Janai and Shaphat in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their brothers from their fathers’ houses were Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jakan, Zia, and Eber, seven in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the sons of Abihail, who was the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahi son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was head of the house of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They lived in Gilead in Bashan, in its towns, and in all the pastures surrounding Sharon, all the way to their borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were listed in genealogies from the days of Jotham king of Judah, and from the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Reuben, the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh had 44,760 men in their armies, warriors armed with shields and swords, as well as archers, trained for war, ready to go out to battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made war with the Hagraites, with Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These tribes received help against the Hagraites, so the Hagraites were delivered into their hands, along with all who were with them, because Israel cried out to God during the battle, and he answered them, because they put their trust in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took away their livestock: fifty thousand of their camels, two hundred fifty thousand sheep, two thousand donkeys, and one hundred thousand living people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So many of the enemy were cut down in battle, because the war was from God. These tribes lived in their place until the captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of the half tribe of Manasseh lived in the land from Bashan to Baal Hermon, Senir, and Mount Hermon. They increased in number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the heads of their fathers’ houses: namely, Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel. They were strong, powerful warriors, famous men, heads of their fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were unfaithful to the God of their fathers and prostituted themselves to the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria, that is, the spirit of Tiglath Pileser king of Assyria, and he carried away the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh, and he took them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and to the river of Gozan, where they are to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Levi were Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, and Hebron and Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The children of Amram were Aaron, Moses, and Miriam.
    The sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Eleazar became the father of Phinehas.
    Phinehas became the father of Abishua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Abishua became the father of Bukki.
    Bukki became the father of Uzzi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Uzzi became the father of Zerahiah.
    Zerahiah became the father of Meraioth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Meraioth became the father of Amariah.
    Amariah became the father of Ahitub.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ahitub became the father of Zadok.
    Zadok became the father of Ahima’az.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ahima’az became the father of Azariah.
    Azariah became the father of Johanan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Johanan became the father of Azariah, who served as priest in the House that Solomon built in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azariah became the father of Amariah.
    Amariah became the father of Ahitub.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ahitub became the father of Zadok.
    Zadok became the father of Shallum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shallum became the father of Hilkiah.
    Hilkiah became the father of Azariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azariah became the father of Seraiah.
    Seraiah became the father of Jehozadak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehozadak went into captivity, when the Lord carried Judah and Jerusalem away by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Levi were Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the sons of Gershom: Libni and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi.
These are the clans of the Levites according to their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The family line of Gershom was his son Libni, his son Jahath, his son Zimmah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his son Joah, his son Iddo, his son Zerah, and his son Jeatherai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The family line of Kohath was his son Amminadab, his son Korah, his son Assir,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his son Elkanah, and his son Ebiasaph, his son Assir,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his son Tahath, his son Uriel, his son Uzziah, and his son Shaul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Elkanah were Amasai and Ahimoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for Elkanah, the family line of Elkanah was his son Zophai, his son Nahath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his son Eliab, his son Jeroham, his son Elkanah, and his son Samuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Samuel were Joel the firstborn and Abijah the second son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The family line of Merari was Mahli, his son Libni, his son Shimei, his son Uzzah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his son Shimea, his son Haggiah, his son Asaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the men David appointed to be the musicians in the Lord’s house from the time that the Ark came to rest there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ministered with music in front of the Dwelling, that is, the Tent of Meeting, until Solomon built the Lord’s house in Jerusalem. They performed their service according to the duties prescribed for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the list of those who served and their sons.
From the family line of the Kohathites came Heman the singer, who was the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heman’s colleague, who stood at his right hand, was Asaph, namely, Asaph the son of Berekiah, the son of Shimea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Michael, the son of Ba’aseiah, the son of Malkijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jahath, the son of Gershom, the son of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the left hand of Heman and Asaph was their colleague from the descendants of Merari, namely, Ethan the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluk,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shemer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their brothers, the other Levites, were appointed for all the other forms of service at the Dwelling, God’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it was Aaron and his sons who presented offerings on the altar for burnt offerings and on the altar for incense, to carry out all the work of the Most Holy Place and to make atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the family line from Aaron: his son Eleazar, his son Phinehas, his son Abishua,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his son Bukki, his son Uzzi, his son Zerahiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his son Meraioth, his son Amariah, his son Ahitub,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his son Zadok, and his son Ahima’az.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the following are the places they lived according to their settlements within their borders.
The first lot was for the sons of Aaron, from the families of the Kohathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To them they gave Hebron in the land of Judah and its surrounding pastureland,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the fields of the city and its villages, they gave to Caleb son of Jephunneh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the sons of Aaron they gave Hebron, the city of refuge, and also Libnah with its surrounding pastures, Jattir, Eshtemoa with its surrounding pastures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hilen with its surrounding pastures, Debir with its surrounding pastures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ashan with its surrounding pastures, and Juttah and Beth Shemesh with their surrounding pastures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the territory of the tribe of Benjamin they received Gibeon, Geba with its surrounding pastures, Allemeth with its surrounding pastures, and Anathoth with its surrounding pastures. All their cities for all their families totaled thirteen cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the rest of the sons of Kohath from the families of the tribe who remained without land, ten cities were given by lot from the territory of the half tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the sons of Gershom, according to their families, from the territory of the tribe of Issachar and the tribe of Asher and the tribe of Naphtali and the tribe of Manasseh in Bashan, thirteen cities were given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the sons of Merari, according to their families, from the territory of the tribe of Reuben and the tribe of Gad and the tribe of Zebulun, twelve cities were given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people of Israel gave the Levites these cities with their surrounding pastures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They assigned to them by lot these cities which are mentioned by name from the territory of the tribe of the sons of Judah and the tribe of the sons of Simeon and the tribe of the sons of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the families of the sons of Kohath had cities of their inheritance within the borders of the tribe of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave to them the city of refuge, Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim with its surrounding pastures, also Gezer with its surrounding pastures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jokmeam with its surrounding pastures, Beth Horon with its surrounding pastures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aijalon with its surrounding pastures, Gath Rimmon with its surrounding pastures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the territory of the half tribe of Manasseh, for the rest of the family of the sons of Kohath, they gave Aner with its surrounding pastures and Bileam with its surrounding pastures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the sons of Gershom, from the clan of the half tribe of Manasseh, these cities were given: Golan in Bashan with its surrounding pastures and Ashtaroth with its surrounding pastures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the territory of the tribe of Issachar, Kedesh with its surrounding pastures, Daberath with its surrounding pastures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ramoth with its surrounding pastures, and Anem with its surrounding pastures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the territory of the tribe of Asher, Mashal with its surrounding pastures, Abdon with it surrounding pastures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hukok with its surrounding pastures, and Rehob with its surrounding pastures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the territory of the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee with its surrounding pastures, Hammon with its surrounding pastures, and Kiriathaim with its surrounding pastures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the Levites, the sons of Merari, were given Jokneam with its surrounding pastures, Rimmono with its surrounding pastures, Tabor with its surrounding pastures, and Nahalal with its surrounding pastures in the territory of the tribe of Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Across the Jordan from Jericho, on the east side of the Jordan, they were given cities in the territory of the tribe of Reuben: Bezer in the wilderness with its surrounding pastures, Jahzah with its surrounding pastures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedemoth with its surrounding pastures, and Mepha’ath with its surrounding pastures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the territory of the tribe of Gad they received Ramoth in Gilead with its surrounding pastures, Mahanaim with its surrounding pastures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heshbon with its surrounding pastures, and Jazer with its surrounding pastures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Issachar were Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron, four in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Tola were Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Samuel, heads of their fathers’ houses. In the days of David the number of powerful warriors written in the genealogies of the family of Tola was 22,600.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Uzzi was Izrahiah. The sons of Izrahiah were Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Ishiah, five, all of them head men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the genealogical records of their fathers’ houses, because they had many wives and sons, they had with them 36,000 men in divisions available for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their brothers among all the families of Issachar, powerful warriors, who were listed in the genealogy, were 87,000 in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Benjamin were Bela, Beker, and Jediael, three in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Bela were Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri, five, all heads of their fathers’ houses. Their powerful warriors listed in the genealogical records were 22,034.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Beker were Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth. All these were the sons of Beker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were listed in the genealogical records as heads of their fathers’ houses, along with 20,200 powerful warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Jediael was Bilhan.
The sons of Bilhan were Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Kena’anah, Zethan, Tarshish, and Ahishahar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were sons of Jediael, the heads of their fathers’ houses, listed along with 17,200 powerful warriors, who were able to go out to war with the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shuppim and Huppim were the sons of Ir. The Hushim were the sons of Aher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Naphtali were Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, Shallum. They were the grandsons of Bilhah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first son of Manasseh was Asriel, born to his Aramean concubine. She also gave birth to Makir, the father of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Makir took a wife from Huppim and Shuppim. His sister’s name was Ma’akah. The name of Manasseh’s second son was Zelophehad, but Zelophehad had only daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ma’akah, the wife of Makir, gave birth to a son, and she named him Peresh. The name of his brother was Sheresh, and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Ulam was Bedan.
These were the sons of Gilead, the son of Makir, the son of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His sister Hammoleketh gave birth to Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shemida were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Ephraim were Shuthelah, his son Bered, his son Tahath, his son Eleadah, his son Tahath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
his son Zabad, his son Shuthelah, and also Ezer and Elead.
These two were killed by the native men of Gath, because they came down to take away their livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ephraim their father mourned many days, and his brothers came to comfort him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went to his wife, and she conceived and gave birth to a son, and he named him Beriah, because there was trouble with his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His daughter was She’erah, who built lower and upper Beth Horon and Uzzen She’erah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rephah was his son, and Resheph his son, and Telah his son, Tahan his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ladan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nun his son, and Joshua his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their possessions and settlements were Bethel and its towns, and Na’aran on the east, and Gezer on the west with its towns, also Shechem and its towns, as far as Ayyah and its towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Along the borders of the people of Manasseh they received Beth Shean and its towns, Ta’anach and its towns, Megiddo and its towns, and Dor and its towns. The descendants of Joseph, the son of Israel, lived in these towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Asher were Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah. Serah was their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Beriah were Heber and Malkiel, who was the father
of Birzaith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heber became the father of Japhlet, Shomer, Hotham, and their sister Shua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Japhlet were Pasak, Bimhal, and Ashvath. These are the sons of Japhlet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shemer were Ahi, Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of his brother Helem were Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Zophah were Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Be’era.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jether were Jephunneh, Pispah, and Ara.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ulla were Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were the sons of Asher, heads of the houses of their fathers, elite soldiers, powerful warriors, heads of the tribal leaders. The number of them listed in the genealogies for service in war was 26,000 men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benjamin became the father of Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, Aharah the third,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bela had sons: Addar, Gera, Abihud,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abishua, Na’aman, Ahoah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Ehud. They are the heads of fathers’ households for the inhabitants of Geba who were exiled to Manahath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: namely, Na’aman, Ahijah, and Gera, who led them into exile, and he became the father of Uzza and Ahihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shaharaim became a father in the territory of Moab, after he had sent away his wives Hushim and Ba’ara.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By his wife Hodesh he became the father of Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malkam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeuz, Shakia, and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of the houses of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By Hushim, he became the father of Abitub and Elpa’al.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Elpa’al were Eber, Misham, and Shemed, who built Ono and Lod, with its towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Beriah and Shema, who were heads of houses of the fathers of the inhabitants of Aijalon. They put to flight the inhabitants of Gath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Michael, Ishpah, Joha, who were the sons of Beriah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ishmerai, Izliah, Jobab, the sons of Elpa’al.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Jakim, Zikri, Zabdi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adaiah, Beraiah, Shimrath, the sons of Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abdon, Zikri, Hanan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iphdeiah, Penuel, the sons of Shashak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ja’areshiah, Elijah, Zikri, and the sons of Jeroham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were heads of fathers’ households throughout their generations, head men. These lived in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeiel, the father of Gibeon, whose wife’s name was Ma’akah, lived in Gibeon
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with his firstborn son Abdon. Other sons were Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gedor, Ahio, and Zeker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mikloth became the father of Shimeah. They also lived near their brothers in Jerusalem, with their brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ner became the father of Kish.
    Kish became the father of Saul.
    Saul became the father of Jonathan, Malkishua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Jonathan was Meribbaal.
    Meribbaal became the father of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Micah were Pithon, Melek, Tarea, and Ahaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ahaz became the father of Jehoaddah.
    Jehoaddah became the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri.
    Zimri became the father of Moza.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moza became the father of Binea. Raphah was his son, Eleasah his son, and Azel his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azel had six sons, whose names are Azrikam, Bokeru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Eshek his brother were Ulam his firstborn, Jeush his second, and Eliphelet his third.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ulam were powerful warriors, who were archers. They had many sons and grandsons, one hundred fifty. All these were of the descendants of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all Israel was enrolled by their genealogies, and these were written in the Book of the Kings of Israel, until Judah was carried away captive to Babylon because of their unfaithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the first group of inhabitants who settled in their property in their cities consisted of Israelites, priests, Levites, and temple servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People from Judah, people from Benjamin, people from Ephraim, and people from Manasseh lived in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They included Uthai the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani from the sons of Perez, the son of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Shilonites: Asaiah the firstborn and his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the sons of Zerah: Jeuel and their brothers, 690.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the sons of Benjamin: Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also Ibneiah the son of Jeroham, and Elah the son of Uzzi, the son of Mikri, and Meshullam the son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their brothers, according to their genealogies, 956 men. All these men were heads of families, listed according to their fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the priests:
Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, Jakin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Azariah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the supervisor of God’s house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malkijah; and Ma’asai the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their brothers, heads of their fathers’ houses, 1,760 very capable men for the work of the service in God’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the Levites:
        Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, from the descendants of Merari;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, and Mattaniah the son of Mica, the son of Zikri, the son of Asaph;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun, and Berekiah the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The gatekeepers included Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and their brothers (Shallum was in charge),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who previously served in the King’s Gate on the east side of the Temple. They were the gatekeepers for the camp of the descendants of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shallum the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, together with his brothers from his father’s house, the Korahites, were in charge of the work of the service, guardians of the entrance to the Tent. Their fathers had been over the Lord’s camp as guardians of the entrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Phinehas son of Eleazar had been ruler over them in the past, and the Lord had been with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zechariah son of Meshelemiah was gatekeeper of the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All these who were chosen to be gatekeepers in the doorways numbered 212.
Those whom David and Samuel the seer appointed to their office of trust were listed by genealogy, according to their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they and their sons were in charge of the gates of the Lord’s house, when the house was still a tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The gatekeepers were positioned on the four sides: east, west, north, and south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their brothers who were in their villages were to take turns coming in to be with them for a seven-day shift.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So four chief gatekeepers, who were Levites, were in an office of trust and were in charge of the rooms and the treasuries in God’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were stationed around God’s house through the night, because that duty was assigned to them, and their duty was to open it every morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them were in charge of the vessels for the service. They counted them before and after each service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them also were in charge of the furnishings and all the vessels of the sanctuary, as well as the fine flour, wine, oil, incense, and spices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the sons of the priests prepared the mixture of the spices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, was entrusted with making the flatbread for offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of their brothers from the sons of the Kohathites were responsible for preparing the bread that was set out and arranged every Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the singers, heads of fathers’ households of the Levites, who lived in the rooms at the temple and were free from other service, because they were busy with their work day and night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were heads of fathers’ households of the Levites, throughout their generations, head men. These lived at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeiel, the father of Gibeon, whose wife’s name was Ma’akah, lived in Gibeon with
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his firstborn son Abdon, and with Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mikloth became the father of Shimeam. They also lived with their relatives in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ner became the father of Kish.
    Kish became the father of Saul.
    Saul became the father of Jonathan, Malkishua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Jonathan was Meribbaal. Meribbaal became the father of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Micah were Pithon, Melek, Tahrea, and Ahaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ahaz became the father of Jarah.
    Jarah became the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri.
    Zimri became the father of Moza.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moza became the father of Binea, and Rephaiah was his son, Eleasah his son, and Azel his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azel had six sons, whose names were Azrikam, Bokeru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistines fought against Israel, and the men of Israel fled from the Philistines and fell mortally wounded at Mount Gilboa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistines were closing in on Saul and his sons. They struck down Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malkishua, the sons of Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The attack directed at Saul was fierce. The archers targeted him and hit him, and he was in great pain from his wounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Saul said to his armor bearer, “Draw your sword and run me through so that these uncircumcised fellows do not come and abuse me.”
His armor bearer would not do it because he was too afraid. So Saul took his own sword and fell on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the armor bearer saw that Saul was dead, he too fell on his sword and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Saul died, and his three sons, his entire house, died together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the men of Israel who were in the valley saw that their army had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their cities and fled. Then the Philistines came and lived in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day when the Philistines came to strip those who had been killed in the battle, they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They stripped Saul, carried off his head and his armor, and sent them throughout Philistia to spread the good news to their idols and people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put Saul’s armor and weapons in the temple of their gods and impaled his skull in the temple of Dagon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The entire city of Jabesh Gilead heard about everything that the Philistines had done to Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the courageous, strong men set out and carried away the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons. They brought them to Jabesh and buried their bones under the terebinth tree in Jabesh. Then they fasted for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul died as a result of the unfaithfulness which he had commited against the Lord by not keeping the Lord’s command and by seeking a medium to direct his actions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not seek guidance from the Lord. That is why the Lord brought about his death and turned the kingdom over to David the son of Jesse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Israel gathered to David at Hebron to say, “Look! We are your flesh and blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Previously when Saul was king, you led Israel out to battle and back again. Besides, the Lord your God said to you, ‘You shall shepherd my people Israel and be leader over my people Israel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron. David made a covenant with them there in the presence of the Lord. They anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of the Lord from Samuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David and all Israel went to Jerusalem (that is, Jebus). The Jebusites were living in that part of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those living in Jebus said to David, “You will not get in here.” Nevertheless, David captured the stronghold of Zion, which became the City of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David had said, “Whoever attacks the Jebusites first will become the head and commander.” Joab son of Zeruiah went up first and became the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David lived in the stronghold. That is why it is called the City of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built up the city all around the stronghold, from the Millo to the surrounding walls. Joab repaired the rest of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David became greater and greater because the Lord of Armies was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the leaders of David’s elite warriors, who built up support for his kingdom throughout all Israel, in order to make him king, according to the word of the Lord concerning Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the record of David’s elite warriors.
Jashobeam son of Hakmoni, head of the Thirty, wielded his spear against three hundred, who were killed at one time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After him came Eleazar son of Dodo, the Ahohite. He was in the group of three elite warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was with David at Pas Dammim, where there was a plot of land full of barley, when the Philistines were gathered there for battle. The people had been fleeing from the Philistines,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they took their stand in the middle of that plot of land. They defended it and killed the Philistines. The Lord rescued them with a great victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three of the thirty leaders went down to David at the rock by the Cave of Adullam. The army of the Philistines was camping in the Valley of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While David was in the stronghold, the garrison of Philistines was in Bethlehem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David expressed this desire: “Who will give me water to drink from the well of Bethlehem inside the gate?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Three broke through the camp of the Philistines and drew water from the well of Bethlehem inside the gate. They took it and brought it to David. However, David was not willing to drink it. Instead, he poured it out to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I should be cursed by God if I did that. Shall I drink the blood of these men? They risked their lives to bring it to me.” He was not willing to drink it. The three elite warriors carried out these actions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abishai, the brother of Joab, was the leader of the Three. He wielded his spear against three hundred and killed them. His reputation equaled that of the Three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was considered twice as great as the Group of Three. He became their commander. But he did not belong to the Group of Three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benaiah son of Jehoiada, a courageous man from Kabze’el, did great things. He struck down two Lions of God from Moab. He also went down and killed a lion in a cistern on a snowy day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also killed an Egyptian who was seven and a half feet tall. The Egyptian was holding a spear like a weaver’s beam. Benaiah went down to him with a staff, snatched the spear from the hand of the Egyptian, and killed him with his own spear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benaiah son of Jehoiada accomplished these feats. His reputation equaled that of the Three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among the Thirty he was considered great, but he did not belong to the Three. David placed him over his bodyguards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These were the elite warriors of the armies:
Asahel, the brother of Joab,
Elhanan son of Dodo from Bethlehem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shammoth the Harorite,
Helez the Pelonite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ira son of Ikkesh the Tekoan,
Abiezer from Anathoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sibbekai the Hushathite,
Ilai the Ahohite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mahrai the Netophahite,
Heled son of Ba’anah the Netophahite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ithai son of Ribai from Gibeah of Benjamin,
Benaiah the Pirathonite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hurai from the ravines of Ga’ash,
Abiel the Arbathite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azmaveth the Baharumite,
Eliahba the Sha’albonite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the sons of Hashem the Gizonite,
Jonathan son of Shageh the Hararite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ahiam son of Sakar the Hararite,
Eliphal son of Ur,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hepher the Mekerathite,
Ahijah the Pelonite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hezro the Carmelite,
Na’arai son of Ezbai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joel, the brother of Nathan,
Mibhar son of Hagri,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zelek the Ammonite,
Naharai the Berothite, the armor bearer of Joab son of Zeruiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ira the Ithrite,
Gareb the Ithrite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Uriah the Hittite,
Zabad son of Ahlai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Adina son of Shiza the Reubenite, a leader of the Reubenites,
    who had thirty men with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hanan son of Ma’akah
and Joshaphat the Mithnite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Uzzia the Ashterathite,
Shama and Jeiel, the sons of Hotham the Aroerite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jediael son of Shimri,
and his brother Joha the Tizite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Eliel the Mahavite
and Jeribai and Joshaviah, the sons of Elna’am,
and Ithmah the Moabite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliel and Obed and Ja’asiel the Mezobaite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the men who came to David at Ziklag, when he was a fugitive from Saul son of Kish. They were among the warriors who helped him wage war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among them were relatives of Saul from Benjamin, who were able to use bow and arrow and to sling stones right-handed or left-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their leader was Ahiezer along with Joash, sons of Shema’ah the Gibeathite,
    Jeziel and Pelet, sons of Azmaveth,
    Berakah and Jehu the Anathothite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a powerful warrior among the Thirty and over the Thirty,
    Jeremiah and Jahaziel and Johanan and Jozabad the Gederathite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Eluzai and Jerimoth and Bealiah
    and Shemariah and Shephatiah the Haruphite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elkanah, Ishiah, Azarel, Joezer, and Jashobeam, the Korathites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joelah and Zebadiah, sons of Jeroham from Gedor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some men from Gad defected and went to David at the stronghold in the wilderness. They were powerful warriors, military men, skilled for war with shield and spear, with faces like lions and with speed like gazelles on the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ezer the head, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah the tenth, and Makbannai the eleventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These men from Gad were leaders of the army. The less capable were leaders for a hundred, the more capable for a thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the ones who crossed the Jordan in the first month when it was overflowing all its banks. They forced those living in the valleys to the east and the west to flee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men also came from Benjamin and Judah to David at the stronghold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David went out to meet with them and said to them, “If you have come to me with peaceful intentions to help me, my heart will be one with yours. But if you come to betray me to my enemies, even though there is no violence in my hands, the God of our fathers will see and judge.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A spirit came upon Amazai, head of the Thirty. He said, “We are yours, David, and we are with you, son of Jesse. Peace, peace to you, and peace to those helping you, for your God helps you.” David received them and made them leaders of the troops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men from Manasseh deserted to David when he came along with the Philistines for the battle against Saul. These men did not help the Philistines, because the serens of the Philistines decided to send David away, because they thought, “He will desert to his master Saul with our heads.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he went to Ziklag, men from Manasseh deserted to David. They were Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, leaders of groups of a thousand which belonged to Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They helped David against the bands of raiders, because all of them were powerful warriors and commanders in the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every day men kept coming to David to help him, until the army became great, like an army of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The following are the numbers of the troops equipped for war who came to David in Hebron, to turn the kingdom of Saul over to him according to the word of the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the descendants of Judah, bearing shields and spears, 6,800 equipped for war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the descendants of Simeon, powerful warriors, 7,100 equipped for war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the descendants of Levi, 4,600,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehoiada the tribal ruler for Aaron, who had with him 3,700;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also Zadok, a powerful young warrior, and from the house of his father 22 commanders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the descendants of Benjamin, Saul’s relatives, 3,000 (until then the majority of them had been keeping their connection with the house of Saul),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the descendants of Ephraim, 20,800 powerful warriors, men who had earned a name for themselves in the house of their fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the half tribe of Manasseh, 18,000 who were designated by name to come and make David king,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the descendants of Issachar, men who understood the times and what Israel should do, 200 leaders and all their relatives under their command,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Zebulun, 50,000 men qualified to serve in the army, ready to line up for battle with all kinds of weapons for battle and with undivided allegiance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Naphtali, 1,000 commanders and with them 37,000 men with shields and spears,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the Danites, 28,600 men ready to line up for battle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Asher, 40,000 men qualified to serve in the army, ready to line up for battle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from east of the Jordan, from Reuben, Gad, and the half tribe of Manasseh, with all the weapons of an army ready for battle, 120,000 men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these soldiers, organized for battle, totally committed, came to Hebron to make David king over all Israel. All the rest of Israel also was totally committed to make David king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were there with David for three days, eating and drinking, because their fellow citizens had prepared provisions for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, their neighbors from as far away as Issachar, Zebulun, and Naphtali were bringing food on donkeys, camels, mules, and oxen, including provisions of flour, cakes of figs, clusters of raisins, wine, olive oil, oxen, and sheep in abundance, because there was joy in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David consulted with the commanders of the thousands and of the hundreds, with every leader.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to the whole assembly of Israel, “If it seems good to you and receives approval from the Lord our God, we should send word everywhere to our brothers who remain in the whole land of Israel and get together with them. We will also send word to the priests and to the Levites in their cities with their pasturelands that they should assemble with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will bring the Ark of our God back to us, because we did not seek it during the days of Saul.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole assembly agreed to do it because it was the right thing to do in the view of all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David gathered all Israel from the Shihor River in Egypt to the entrance of Hamath, to bring the Ark of God from Kiriath Jearim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David and all Israel went up to Baalah in Judah (that is, Kiriath Jearim) to bring up the ark from there, the Ark of God the Lord, who is seated above the cherubim and who is called by the Name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They transported God’s ark on a new cart from the house of Abinadab. Uzzah and Ahio were leading the cart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David and all Israel were celebrating enthusiastically before God with songs, lyres, harps, hand drums, cymbals, and trumpets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the threshing floor of Kidon, Uzzah reached out to grab the ark because the oxen stumbled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The anger of the Lord burned against Uzzah, and the Lord struck him down because Uzzah reached out his hand to the ark. He died there in the presence of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David was angry because the Lord had burst out against Uzzah. That place is called Perez Uzzah to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David was afraid of God on that day. He said, “How can I bring the Ark of God to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David did not take the ark along with him into the City of David. He set it aside in the house of Obed Edom the Gittite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Ark of God stayed in the house of Obed Edom for three months, and the Lord blessed the house of Obed Edom and all that belonged to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, along with cedar logs, stonemasons, and carpenters to build a palace for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David knew that the Lord had established him as king over Israel because his kingdom had been lifted high for the sake of his people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David took wives in Jerusalem and fathered sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the children born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elishama, Be’eliada, and Eliphelet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel. So all the Philistines went up to search for David. David heard about it and went out to face them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistines came and made a raid in the Valley of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David asked God, “Shall I go up against the Philistines? Will you give them into my hand?”
The Lord said to him, “Go up, and I will give them into your hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went up to Baal Perazim, and David defeated the Philistines there. David said, “By my hand God has broken through my enemies like a wall of water.” That is why they named that place Baal Perazim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistines abandoned their gods there. David gave the order, and they were burned with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistines made another raid in the valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David again consulted God. God said to him, “Do not go directly at them. Go around them and come to them in the area of the balsam trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the balsam trees, you are to go out in battle, because God has gone out before you to strike the army of the Philistines.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David did what God had commanded him, and they struck the army of the Philistines from Gibeon to Gezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David’s reputation spread into all the lands. The Lord caused all the nations to be terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David constructed buildings for himself in the City of David. He established a place for the Ark of God and pitched a tent for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said, “Nobody is to carry God’s ark except the Levites, because the Lord chose them to carry the Ark of the Lord and to serve him forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David gathered all Israel in Jerusalem to bring up the Ark of the Lord to the place that he had prepared for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David gathered the descendants of Aaron and the Levites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: representing the sons of Kohath were Uriel the leader and 120 of his relatives,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: representing the sons of Merari were Asaiah the leader and 220 of his relatives,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: representing the sons of Gershom were Joel the leader and 130 of his relatives,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: representing the sons of Elizaphan were Shemaiah the leader and 200 of his relatives,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: representing the sons of Hebron were Eliel the leader and 80 of his relatives,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: representing the sons of Uzziel were Amminadab the leader and 112 of his relatives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David summoned the priests Zadok and Abiathar and the Levites Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You are the leading fathers of the descendants of Levi. Consecrate yourselves, you and your brothers. Bring up the Ark of the Lord, the God of Israel, to the place prepared for it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the first time, when you were not there, the Lord our God burst out against us, because we did not inquire about and follow the proper procedures.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests and the Levites consecrated themselves to bring up the Ark of the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Levi carried the Ark of God with poles on their shoulders, as Moses had commanded according to the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David told the leading officials of the Levites to appoint their brother Levites as singers with musical instruments, harps, lyres, and cymbals, to raise their voices for the people to hear with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites appointed Heman son of Joel, and from the Levites closely related to him they appointed Asaph son of Berekiah, and from their relatives who were the descendants of Merari they appointed Ethan son of Kushaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their brother Levites assigned to serve with them on the second level were Zechariah, Ja’aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Ma’aseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, and Mikneiah, and Obed Edom and Jeiel, the gatekeepers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also appointed were the singers Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, to sound the bronze cymbals,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Ma’aseiah, and Benaiah, to play the harps according to alamoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator
