verses.text: and Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed Edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah with lyres, to lead according to sheminith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kenaniah was musical leader of the Levites, directing the music because he had the skill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Berekiah and Elkanah were gatekeepers for the Ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The priests Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer were directed to blow trumpets before the Ark of God.
Obed Edom and Jehiah were also gatekeepers for the Ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David, the elders of Israel, and the leaders of the units of a thousand were going to bring up the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord from the house of Obed Edom. They were celebrating as they went,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because God was helping the Levites who were carrying the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord. They sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David was clothed with a fine linen robe, as were all of the Levites who were carrying the ark, the singers, and Kenaniah, the choir director for the singers. David was wearing a special linen vest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Israel brought up the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord with shouts, with the sound of the ram’s horn, trumpets, and cymbals, and with music on harps and lyres.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord came to the City of David, Michal, the daughter of Saul, looked out through the window. She saw King David dancing and celebrating, and she despised him in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the Ark of God and set it inside the tent that David had pitched for it. They offered burnt offerings and fellowship offerings before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David had finished offering the burnt offerings and the fellowship offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He distributed to each and every Israelite man and woman a loaf of bread, a cake of dates, and a cake of raisins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He designated the following individuals from the Levites to serve before the Ark of the Lord by remembering, thanking, and praising the Lord, the God of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Asaph was the leader. Zechariah was directly under him.
    Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed Edom, and Jeiel were to play music on harps and lyres.
    Asaph was sounding the cymbals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benaiah and Jahaziel, the priests with trumpets, were to be continually before the Ark of the Covenant of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day David first gave the directive to give thanks to the Lord through the ministry of Asaph and his associates:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord.
    Call on his name.
    Make known his deeds among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to him.
    Make music to him.
    Tell about all his wonderful acts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise his holy name.
    The hearts of those who seek the Lord will rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seek the Lord and his strength.
    Seek his presence continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember his wonderful acts, his signs,
        and the judgments from his mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you descendants of Israel, his servant,
    you sons of Jacob, his chosen ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is the Lord our God.
    His judgments are in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember his covenant forever,
    a word he commanded for a thousand generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
his covenant which he made with Abraham,
    which was his sworn promise to Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He confirmed it to Jacob as a statute for Israel,
        an everlasting covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
        as a portion for your inheritance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
even though your numbers are small,
    and you are insignificant,
    and you are living in it as aliens.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were wandering from nation to nation
    and from one kingdom to another people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet he did not permit anyone to oppress them.
    He rebuked kings on their account:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You must not touch my anointed ones.
    Against my prophets you must do no harm.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord, all the earth.
    Proclaim the good news of his salvation from day to day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Declare his glory among the nations,
    his wonderful acts among all the peoples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for great is the Lord and greatly to be praised.
    He is to be feared above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all the gods of the peoples are not gods at all.
    But the Lord made the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Honor and majesty are before him.
    Strength and joy are in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe to the Lord, you families of the peoples.
    Ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe to the Lord the glory of his name.
    Bring an offering and come before him.
    Worship the Lord in the splendor of holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tremble before him, all the earth.
    Surely the world stands firm.
    It shall never be overthrown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens will be glad.
    The earth will rejoice.
    They will say among the nations, “The Lord reigns.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sea and everything that fills it will roar.
    The fields and everything in them will celebrate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The trees of the forest will sing for joy before the Lord,
        for he is coming to judge the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,
        for his mercy endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say, “Save us, O God of our salvation.
    Gather us and save us from the nations,
        to give thanks to your holy name,
        to glorify you by praising you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the Lord, the God of Israel,
        from everlasting to everlasting.
Then all the people said “Amen” and praised the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David left Asaph and his relatives there before the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord, to minister before the Ark continually, to do whatever was needed each day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with Obed Edom and sixty-eight relatives. Obed Edom son of Jeduthun and Hosah served as gatekeepers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zadok the priest and his fellow priests were assigned to the Tent of the Lord at the high place in Gibeon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to present burnt offerings to the Lord upon the altar for burnt offerings regularly, morning and evening, according to everything written in the Law of the Lord, which he commanded Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With them were Heman, Jeduthun, and the rest of those chosen and designated by name to give thanks to the Lord, because his mercy endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With them were Heman and Jeduthun to make music to God with trumpets, cymbals, and musical instruments. The descendants of Jeduthun were assigned to the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people departed, each to his own house, and David returned to bless his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After David was living in his own house, he said to Nathan the prophet, “Look! I am living in a house of cedar, but the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord sits under tent curtains.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nathan said to David, “Do everything that is in your heart, because God is with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that night the word of God came to Nathan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go and tell David my servant these things.”
This is what the Lord says. You will not be the one to build a house for me to live in,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have not lived in a house from the day when I caused Israel to go up from Egypt until this day, but I have been in a moving tent as my dwelling place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all my traveling about with all the Israelites, did I ever speak a word with one of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to shepherd my people, or ask, “Why have you not built a house of cedar for me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now you are also to say the following to my servant David:
This is what the Lord of Armies says. I took you from the pastures, from following the sheep, to be ruler over my people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have been with you wherever you went. I have cut off all your enemies before you. I will make a reputation for you like the reputation of the great ones in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will establish a place for my people Israel, and I will plant them there. They will dwell there, and they will not be disturbed anymore. I will not allow wicked men to devastate them again as I did in the beginning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and as it happened during the times when I commanded judges over my people Israel, but I will subdue all your enemies.
I declare to you that the Lord will build a house for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When your days are completed, you will go to be with your fathers. I will raise up your seed after you from among your sons, and I will establish his kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will build a house for me. I will establish his throne forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will be his father, and he will be my son. My mercy I will not take away from him as I took it from the one who was before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will cause him to stand in my house and in my kingdom forever. His throne will be established forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nathan told David all the words that had been revealed in this vision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then King David went and sat before the Lord and said:
Who am I, Lord God, and what is my house that you have brought me to this point?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet this was a small thing in your eyes, God! You have spoken about the house of your servant for a long time into the future. You have revealed to me the course for the man who will arise, Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What more can David add to you for honoring your servant? You know your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, for the sake of your servant and according to the plan of your heart, you have carried out this great thing by making known all these great promises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, there is none like you, and there is no God besides you, as is apparent from everything which our ears have heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is like your people Israel? It is the one nation on earth for whom God went out to redeem a people to himself, to make for yourself a great name, by doing great and awe-inspiring things in order to drive out nations in front of your people, whom you redeemed from Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You adopted Israel as your people forever. You, O Lord, became their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, Lord, the word which you have spoken about your servant and about his house will stand firm forever. Do as you have spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will stand firm. Your name will be great forever. It will be said: The Lord of Armies is the God of Israel. The house of David your servant will be established before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you, my God, have whispered into the ear of your servant that you would build a house for him. That is why your servant has dared to pray before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, Lord, you are God and have said these good things concerning your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you have been pleased to bless the house of your servant to be forever before you. For what you, Lord, have blessed is blessed forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this David defeated the Philistines. He subdued them and took Gath and its villages from the control of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He defeated Moab, so the Moabites became subjects of David and paid tribute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David also defeated Hadadezer king of Zobah, as he was on his way to Hamath to establish control at the river Euphrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David took from him one thousand chariots, seven thousand charioteers, and twenty thousand foot soldiers. He hamstrung all the chariot horses but left enough for one hundred chariots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arameans from Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, but David killed twenty-two thousand men in Aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David placed garrisons in Damascus in Aram. So the Arameans became subject to David and paid tribute.
The Lord gave victory to David everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David took the gold shields which belonged to the officials of Hadadezer and brought them to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Tibhath and Kun, cities of Hadadezer, David took huge amounts of bronze. With it Solomon later made the sea, the pillars, and the bronze vessels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tou king of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of Hadadezer king of Zobah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent his son Hadoram to King David to ask for peace with him and to bless him, because he had fought against and defeated Hadadezer, who had been at war with Tou. He sent all kinds of articles of gold, silver, and bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King David dedicated these to the Lord, along with the silver and gold which he had carried off from all the nations, from Edom, Moab, Ammon, the Philistines, and Amalek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abishai son of Zeruiah killed eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He placed garrisons in Edom. All Edom was subject to David.
The Lord gave victory to David everywhere he went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David was king over all Israel, and he treated his people with justice and fairness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joab son of Zeruiah was over the army.
    Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was the record keeper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zadok son of Ahitub and Ahimelek son of Abiathar were the priests.
    Shavsha was the secretary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Kerethites and the Pelethites.
    The sons of David were chief advisors at the side of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Nahash king of the Ammonites died, and his son became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David said, “I will show kindness to Hanun son of Nahash, just as his father showed kindness to me.” David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father.
But when David’s officials came to the land of the Ammonites to console Hanun,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the officers of the Ammonites said to Hanun, “Do you really think David is honoring your father because he has sent messengers to express sympathy to you? Haven’t his officials come to you as scouts to spy on the land and to overthrow it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hanun seized David’s officials, shaved them, and cut off their clothing up to the middle of their buttocks and sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they were sent on their way, David received a report about these men. David sent messengers to meet them, for the men were deeply humiliated. The king said, “Stay in Jericho until your beards have grown, and then return.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Ammonites saw that they had made themselves a disgusting stench to David. Hanun and the Ammonites sent a thousand talents of silver to hire chariots and charioteers for themselves from Aram of the Two Rivers, from Aram Ma’akah, and from Zobah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They hired thirty-two thousand chariots, the king of Ma’akah, and his troops. They came and set up camp in front of Medeba. The Ammonites were called together from their cities, and they came for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David heard about this, he deployed Joab and the entire army of powerful warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Ammonites came out and lined up in battle formation in front of the entrance to the city. The kings who had come from Aram were lined up by themselves in the open country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab saw that the battle lines were drawn up against him both in front of him and behind him, so he chose some of the best troops of Israel and deployed them to confront the Arameans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the army he put under the command of his brother Abishai. They were deployed to confront the Ammonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “If Aram is too strong for me, you will come to my rescue, and if the Ammonites are too strong for you, I will rescue you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be strong and act courageously for our people and for the cities of our God. The Lord will do what is good in his eyes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab and the people who were with him confronted the Arameans in the battle, and the Arameans fled from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Ammonites saw that the Arameans had fled, they also fled from Joab’s brother Abishai and entered the city. Joab returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Arameans saw that they had been defeated, they sent messengers and summoned the Arameans who were from beyond the Euphrates. Shophak the commander of the army of Hadadezer was leading them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was reported to David, so he gathered all Israel and crossed the Jordan. He came upon them and deployed for battle against them. David deployed for battle to engage Aram, and they fought against each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Arameans fled from Israel. David killed seven thousand Aramean charioteers and forty thousand foot soldiers. He also killed Shophak the commander of the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The kings subject to Hadadezer saw that they were defeated by Israel. They made peace with David and became subject to him. Then Aram was not willing to rescue the Ammonites anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When springtime arrived, the time when kings go out to war, Joab led out the army, ravaged the land of the Ammonites, and besieged Rabbah. David remained in Jerusalem. Joab attacked Rabbah and pulled it down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David took the gold crown of their king from his head. It weighed seventy-five pounds and had a precious stone in it. It was placed on David’s head. He brought out large amounts of plunder from the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought out the people who were in the city. He put them to work with saws, iron picks, and axes. David did the same to all the cities of the Ammonites. Then David and all the troops returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, war arose at Gezer with the Philistines. Then Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, one of the descendants of Rapha the giant, and the Philistines were subdued.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was another battle with the Philistines. Elhanan, the son of Jair, killed Lahmi, the brother of Goliath the Gittite. The shaft of his spear was like a weaver’s beam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was another battle, this time at Gath. There was a very tall man who had six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot, twenty-four digits in all. He also was descended from Rapha the giant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taunted Israel, but Jonathan, the son of Shimeah, David’s brother, killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were descended from the giant in Gath. They fell by the hand of David and the men who served him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Satan stood up against Israel and incited David to count Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Joab and to the officers of the army, “Go, count Israel from Beersheba to Dan. Let me know how many they are.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab said, “The Lord will multiply his people a hundred times. Are not all of them your servants, my lord the king? Why does my lord want to do this? Why should there be guilt upon Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the word of the king overruled Joab.
Joab went throughout all Israel and came back to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He reported the total number of the people to David: In all Israel there were one million one hundred thousand men who could draw the sword, including four hundred seventy thousand from Judah who could draw the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not include Levi and Benjamin in the census because the king’s directive was offensive to Joab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This action was also evil in the eyes of God, so he struck Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to God, “I have sinned greatly by doing this. Please forgive the guilt of your servant, for I have acted very foolishly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Gad, David’s seer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go tell David this is what the Lord has said. I am offering you three choices. Choose one of them for yourself, and I will impose it on you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Gad came to David and said to him, “This is what the Lord says. Choose one of these for yourself:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: either three years of famine, or three months of devastation in which you are overwhelmed by the sword of your enemies, or three days of the sword of the Lord bringing plague on the land, with the angel of the Lord causing destruction throughout all the territory of Israel. Now decide what answer I should take back to the one who sent me with this directive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Gad, “This puts me in a difficult position. Please let me fall into the hand of the Lord, because his compassion is very great. But do not let me fall into the hands of man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord caused a plague in Israel. Seventy thousand men from Israel fell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it. The Lord saw the destruction, and he relented from this devastation. He said to the destroying angel, “Enough. Hold back your hand.”
The angel of the Lord was standing by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David looked up and saw the angel of the Lord standing between the earth and the heavens, with his sword drawn in his hand and stretched out over Jerusalem. David and the elders, who were clothed in sackcloth, fell on their faces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to God, “Look, I am the one who said to count the people. I am the one who has sinned and acted very wickedly. But these sheep! What have they done, O Lord my God? Please let your hand be on me and on the house of my father. But not a plague on your people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel of the Lord told Gad to tell David to go and set up an altar to the Lord on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David went up according to the directive from Gad, which he had spoken in the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Ornan was threshing wheat, he turned and saw the angel. Ornan and his four sons hid themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As David approached Ornan, Ornan looked up and saw David. He went out from the threshing floor and bowed to David with his face to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Ornan, “Give me the site of the threshing floor. I will build an altar to the Lord on it. You will give it to me for full price, and the plague will be averted from the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ornan said to David, “Take it for yourself. My lord the king may do what is good in his eyes. Look here. I have given the oxen for burnt offerings, the threshing sledges for the wood, and the wheat for the grain offering. I have given everything.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Ornan, “No. I am determined to buy it for the full price, because I will not take what belongs to you for the Lord and for burnt offerings without paying for it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David weighed out six hundred shekels of gold to Ornan for the site.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David built an altar to the Lord there, and he offered burnt offerings and fellowship offerings. He called to the Lord, and the Lord answered him with fire from heaven upon the altar for burnt offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to the angel. The angel put his sword back into its sheath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, when David saw the Lord had answered him on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, he sacrificed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Dwelling for the Lord, which Moses had made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt offering at that time were at the high place at Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David was not able to go before it to seek answers from God because he was afraid of the sword of the angel of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said, “This is the place for the House of the Lord God and for the altar for burnt offerings for Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to gather together the aliens who were residents in the land of Israel. He lined up stonecutters to prepare trimmed stones for building the house for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He provided a large amount of iron for making nails for the doors of the gates, and he provided so much bronze for the fittings that it was not weighed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He provided cedar logs beyond number because the Sidonians and Tyrians brought a large supply of cedar logs to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said, “My son Solomon is young and inexperienced. The house to be built for the Lord will make his name very great and give him glory in all the lands. Therefore, I will make preparations for it.” So David completed many of the preparations before his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He summoned his son Solomon and commanded him to build a house for the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David said to Solomon:
My son, I had it in my heart to build a house for the name of the Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this word of the Lord was laid upon me: “You have shed much blood. You have waged great wars. You will not build a house for my name because of the great amount of blood you have shed on the earth in my presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You see, a son has been born to you. He will be a man of peace. To him I will give peace from all the enemies around him. Solomon will be his name. I will bestow peace and quiet upon Israel in his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will build a house for my name. He will be my son. I will be his father. I will establish the throne of his kingdom in Israel forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, my son, the Lord will be with you. You will succeed. You will build the house for the Lord your God, as he has said about you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will give you discretion and understanding. He will give you orders about Israel and about how to keep the Law of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will prosper if you will continue to carry out the statutes and the judgments that the Lord commanded Moses for Israel. Be strong and be courageous. Do not be afraid and do not be dismayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look! With great effort I have provided one hundred thousand talents of gold for the House of the Lord, a million talents of silver, and too much bronze and iron to be weighed. I have provided lumber and stones. You may add to what I have provided.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are plenty of laborers available to you, namely, stonecutters, masons, and wood workers, and those capable in all kinds of crafts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also workers with gold, silver, bronze, and iron, too many to count. Get up and do it. The Lord will be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David commanded all the officials and officers of Israel to help his son Solomon. He said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not the Lord your God with you? He has given you peace on all sides by giving the inhabitants of the land into my hand. The land has been subdued before the Lord and before his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now devote your hearts and your minds to seek the Lord your God. Get up and build the holy place for the Lord God, in order to bring the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord and the holy vessels of God into the house built for the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David was old and had lived a long life, he made his son Solomon king over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gathered together all the officials and officers of Israel, along with the priests and the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites who were thirty years old and over were counted, and their total number, man by man, was thirty-eight thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said, “Of these, twenty-four thousand are to oversee the work of the Lord’s house, six thousand are to be officers and judges,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: four thousand are to be gatekeepers, and four thousand are to praise the Lord with the musical instruments that I made for giving praise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David assigned them to divisions based on their descent from the sons of Levi, namely, Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Gershonites were descended from Ladan and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ladan were Jehiel, who was the head, then Zetham and Joel, three in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shimei were Shelomoth, Haziel, and Haran, three in all. These were the heads of the fathers’ households of Ladan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shimei were Jahath, Ziza, Jeush, and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second, but Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons. That is why they were counted as only one father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Amram were Aaron and Moses.
Aaron was set apart to consecrate the most holy things. He and his sons received a permanent assignment to burn incense before the Lord, to minister to him, and to bless his name forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Moses, the man of God, however, were classified along with the rest of the tribe of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Moses were Gershom and Eliezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Gershom was Shebuel the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Eliezer was Rehabiah the head.
    Eliezer had no other sons, but Rehabiah had very many sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Izhar was Shelomith the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Hebron were Jeriah the head, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Uzziel were Micah the head, and Ishiah the second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi.
    The sons of Mahli were Eleazar and Kish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleazar died, and he had no sons but only daughters, so their cousins the sons of Kish took them as wives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Mushi were Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth, three in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the descendants of Levi who were registered by their fathers’ houses. They were listed under the heads of their fathers’ houses. All those twenty years old and older were counted man by man and registered by name to perform the work for the service of the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David had said, “The Lord, the God of Israel, has given rest to his people, and he dwells in Jerusalem forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so the Levites will no longer need to carry the Dwelling and all the vessels and utensils for its service.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So according to the last directions given by David, the descendants of Levi twenty years old and older were counted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their work was to assist the descendants of Aaron in the service of the Lord’s house, in the courtyards, in the storage rooms, and in the purification of all the holy things, that is, in all the work of the service of God’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their responsibilities included the bread that was to be set out and the fine flour for the grain offerings (whether for unleavened wafers, or for offerings baked in a pan, or those soaked in oil). They also did all of the measuring and mixing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also were to stand and thank and praise the Lord every morning, and likewise in the evening,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to offer all burnt offerings to the Lord on the sabbaths, on the new moons, and on the prescribed festivals. They were to serve continually before the Lord, in the number specified by the regulations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that they would diligently carry out their duties for the Tent of Meeting, their duties for the Holy Place, and their duties with their brothers, the descendants of Aaron, for the service of the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The following were the divisions for the sons of Aaron.
The sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because Nadab and Abihu died before their father and had no children, Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David, together with Zadok, the representative of the male descendants of Eleazar, and Ahimelek, the representative of the male descendants of Ithamar, divided the priests into divisions to be assigned different forms of service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the descendants of Eleazar had more men who were leaders of large groups than the descendants of Ithamar did, this is how the priests were divided: From the descendants of Eleazar there were sixteen heads of fathers’ houses, and from the descendants of Ithamar there were eight heads of their fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were assigned to their duties impartially by drawing lots. There were officials for the sanctuary and officials to serve in the presence of God from the sons of Eleazar and from the sons of Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shemaiah son of Nethanel, the scribe, who was a Levite, recorded the lots in the presence of the king and the government officials, namely, Zadok the priest, Ahimelek son of Abiathar, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the priests and of the Levites. One father’s house was chosen from the descendants of Eleazar, then another, and then one was chosen from the descendants of Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The first lot came out for Jehoiarib,
    the second for Jedaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the third for Harim,
    the fourth for Seorim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the fifth for Malkijah,
    the sixth for Mijamin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the seventh for Hakkoz,
    the eighth for Abijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the ninth for Jeshua,
    the tenth for Shekaniah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the eleventh for Eliashib,
    the twelfth for Jakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the thirteenth for Huppah,
    the fourteenth for Jeshebeab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the fifteenth for Bilgah,
    the sixteenth for Immer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the seventeenth for Hezir,
    the eighteenth for Happizzez,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the nineteenth for Pethahiah,
    the twentieth for Jehezkel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the twenty-first for Jakin,
    the twenty-second for Gamul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the twenty-third for Delaiah,
    and the twenty-fourth for Ma’aziah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were their assigned groups for their service, to come into the Lord’s house according to the regulations given to them by their forefather Aaron, as the Lord, the God of Israel, had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the rest of the descendants of Levi, the following were the heads and founders of divisions.
Shubael was from the sons of Amram,
and Jehdeiah was from the sons of Shubael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ishiah was the head from Rehabiah and the sons of Rehabiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shelomoth was from the Izharites,
and Jahath was from the sons of Shelomoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Hebron were Jeriah, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Micah was from the sons of Uzziel,
and Shamir was from the sons of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ishiah was the brother of Micah,
and Zechariah was from the sons of Ishiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi.
The son of Ja’aziah was Beno.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari from Ja’aziah were Beno, Shoham, Zakkur, and Ibri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Kish: the son of Kish was Jerahme’el.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Mushi were Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth.
These were the descendants of the Levites according to their fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These all cast lots just as their brothers the sons of Aaron had done in the presence of King David and of Zadok, Ahimelek, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the priests and of the Levites. The fathers’ houses of the oldest son cast lots just as those of his youngest brother did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In addition, David and the officers of the army set apart for service certain of the sons of Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun, who were to prophesy with lyres, harps, and cymbals. This is the list of the men set apart for this work of service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the sons of Asaph:
Zakkur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asarelah. The sons of Asaph were under the direction of Asaph, who prophesied at the order of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun were:
Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the direction of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied by giving thanks and praising the Lord with the lyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From Heman, the sons of Heman were:
    Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti Ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were the sons of Heman, the king’s seer, to fulfill the promise of God to exalt him. God gave to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were under the direction of their father to make music in the Lord’s house, with cymbals, harps, and lyres, for the service of God’s house. Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman were under the direction of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of them, with their brothers who were instructed in singing to the Lord, all of whom were skillful, was two hundred eighty-eight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cast lots for their offices, all alike, the least as well as the greatest, the teacher as well as the student.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the first lot came out for Asaph’s son Joseph. ⎣He and his brothers and sons totaled twelve.⎦
    The second lot fell to Gedaliah, his brothers and sons, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the third to Zakkur, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fourth to Izri, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fifth to Nethaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sixth to Bukkiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the seventh to Jesarelah, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the eighth to Jeshaiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ninth to Mattaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the tenth to Shimei, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the eleventh to Azarel, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twelfth to Hashabiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the thirteenth lot Shubael, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the fourteenth Mattithiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the fifteenth Jeremoth, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the sixteenth Hananiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the seventeenth Joshbekashah, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the eighteenth Hanani, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the nineteenth Mallothi, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the twentieth Eliathah, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the twenty-first Hothir, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the twenty-second Giddalti, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the twenty-third Mahazioth, his sons and his brothers, twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the twenty-fourth Romamti Ezer, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the gatekeepers, the following were the divisions.
From the Korahites: Meshelemiah son of Kore, from the sons of Asaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, and Eliehoenai the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obed Edom had sons because God blessed him: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sakar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, and Pe’ullethai the eighth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons were also born to his son Shemaiah, who ruled over the house of their father, for they were strong, capable men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shemaiah were Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad, whose brothers were capable men, Elihu and Semakiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were male descendants of Obed Edom. They and their sons and their brothers were strong, capable men for the service. There were sixty-two of them from Obed Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meshelemiah had sons and brothers, capable men, eighteen in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hosah from the descendants of Merari also had sons. They were Shimri the head (for though he was not the firstborn, yet his father made him head),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, and Zechariah the fourth. All the sons and brothers of Hosah totaled thirteen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The following were the divisions of the gatekeepers, according to their influential leaders, who had offices like their brothers, to minister in the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cast lots for every gate according to their fathers’ houses, the small as well as the great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lot for the east side fell to Shelemiah.
Then they cast lots for his son Zechariah, a wise counselor, and his lot came out for the north side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Obed Edom the lot was for the south side, and for his sons the lot was for the storehouse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Shuppim and Hosah the lot was for the west side, by the gate of Shalleketh, by the ramp that goes up. They were stationed with one watchman next to another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the east side there were six Levites each day,
on the north side four each day,
and on the south side four each day,
and at the storehouse two at a time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the covered courtyard on the west side, four were stationed at the ramp, and two at the courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the divisions of the gatekeepers from the descendants of the Korahites and from the descendants of Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Levites, Ahijah was in charge of the treasuries of God’s house and the treasuries for the consecrated things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ladan (who were descendants of Gershon through Ladan and who were the heads of the fathers’ households descended from Ladan the Gershonite) included Jehieli,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sons of Jehieli, Zetham and his brother Joel. They were in charge of the treasuries of the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shebuel, the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was supervisor over the treasuries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His relatives were Eliezer, his son Rehabiah, and his son Jeshaiah, and his son Joram, and his son Zikri, and his son Shelomoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Shelomoth and his brothers were over all the treasuries for the consecrated things, which David the king, together with the heads of the fathers’ households, the officers over thousands and hundreds, and the officers of the army, had dedicated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They dedicated some of the plunder won in battles, to repair the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything that Samuel the seer, Saul son of Kish, Abner son of Ner, and Joab son of Zeruiah had dedicated, regardless of who had dedicated it, was under the control of Shelomoth and of his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Izharites, Kenaniah and his sons were assigned to the civil administration of Israel as officers and judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brothers, seventeen hundred capable men were in charge of the administration of Israel west of the Jordan, for all the work of the Lord and for the service of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Hebronites, Jeriah was the head of the Hebronites on the basis of their genealogical records according to their fathers’ households. The genealogical records were verified in the fortieth year of the reign of David, and capable men were found among them at Jazer of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among Jeriah’s brothers, who were capable men, there were twenty-seven hundred heads of fathers’ households, whom King David made overseers over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half tribe of the Manassites, for every matter pertaining to God, and for every matter pertaining to the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The following is the list of the leaders of the people of Israel, those who were the heads of fathers’ houses and the commanders of military units of a thousand and of a hundred, and the officers who served the king in any matter. They served in divisions that came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year. In every division there were twenty-four thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over the first division for the first month was Jashobeam son of Zabdiel. In his division there were twenty-four thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was from the sons of Perez. He was the head of all the commanders of the army for the first month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over the division for the second month was Dodai the Ahohite. Mikloth was the leader of his division. In his division there were twenty-four thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third commander of the army for the third month was Benaiah son of Jehoiada the head priest. In his division there were twenty-four thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the same Benaiah who was the powerful warrior among the Thirty and the leader of the Thirty. Ammizabad his son was commander of his division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth commander for the fourth month was Asahel, the brother of Joab. Zebadiah his son succeeded him, and in his division there were twenty-four thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth commander for the fifth month was Shamhuth the Izrahite, and in his division there were twenty-four thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth commander for the sixth month was Ira son of Ikkesh the Tekoan, and in his division there were twenty-four thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh commander for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite, from the descendants of Ephraim, and in his division there were twenty-four thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eighth commander for the eighth month was Sibbecai the Hushathite, from the descendants of Zerah. In his division there were twenty-four thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ninth commander for the ninth month was Abiezer the Anathothite, from the descendants of Benjamin. In his division there were twenty-four thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tenth commander for the tenth month was Mahrai the Netophathite, from the descendants of Zerah. In his division there were twenty-four thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eleventh commander for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite, from the descendants of Ephraim. In his division there were twenty-four thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twelfth commander for the twelfth month was Heldai the Netophathite, from Othniel. In his division there were twenty-four thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The following were over the tribes of Israel:
Of the Reubenites, Eliezer son of Zikri was the leader,
Of the Simeonites, Shephatiah son of Ma’akah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Levi, Hashabiah son of Kemuel,
Of the descendants of Aaron, Zadok,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Judah, Elihu, one of the brothers of David,
Of Issachar, Omri son of Michael,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Zebulun, Ishmaiah son of Obadiah,
Of Naphtali, Jeremoth son of Azriel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea son of Azaziah,
Of the half tribe of Manasseh, Joel son of Pedaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of the half tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo son of Zechariah,
Of Benjamin, Ja’asiel son of Abner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Dan, Azarel son of Jeroham.
These were the officers of the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David did not count those twenty years old and under, because the Lord had said he would increase Israel like the stars of the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab son of Zeruiah began to take a census but did not finish, and wrath came on Israel because of this. The number was not put into the account in the annals of King David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azmaveth son of Adiel was in charge of the king’s storehouses.
    Jonathan son of Uzziah was in charge of the storehouses in the fields, in the cities, in the villages, and in the towers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ezri son of Kelub was in charge of those who worked in the fields, farming the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shimei the Ramathite was in charge of the vineyards.
    Zabdi the Shiphmite was in charge of the produce of the vineyards for the wine cellars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Baal Hanan the Gederite was in charge of the olive trees and the sycamore fig trees that were in the Shephelah.
    Joash was in charge of the storehouses for oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shitrai the Sharonite was in charge of the herds that grazed in Sharon.
    Shaphat the son of Adlai was in charge of the herds that were in the lowlands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Obil the Ishmaelite was in charge of the camels.
    Jehdeiah the Meronothite was in charge of the donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jaziz the Hagrite was in charge of the flocks.
All these were in charge of the property which belonged to King David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Jonathan, David’s uncle, was an advisor, a man of understanding, and a scribe. Jehiel son of Hakmoni took care of the king’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahithophel was the king’s counselor, and Hushai the Arkite was the confidant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahithophel was succeeded by Jehoiada son of Benaiah and by Abiathar. Joab was the commander of the king’s army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David gathered all the officials of Israel in Jerusalem: namely, the officials over the tribes, the officers over the military divisions that served the king (the officers over the units of a thousand and the units of a hundred), the officials who were in charge of all the property and cattle that belonged to the king and his sons, together with the palace officials, the powerful men, all the strong, capable men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then King David stood up and said:
Listen to me, my brothers and my people. In my heart I wanted to build a house as a resting place for the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord and as a footstool for our God. So I made preparations to build.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said to me, “You will not build a house for my name because you are a man of war, and you have shed blood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the Lord, the God of Israel, chose me from the whole house of my father to become king over Israel forever, because he chose Judah as leader, and in the house of Judah he chose the house of my father, and among the sons of my father he took pleasure in me to make me king over all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From all my sons (the Lord has given me many sons) he has chosen my son Solomon to sit upon the throne of the kingdom of the Lord over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to me, “Solomon, your son, is the one who will build my house and my courtyards, because I have chosen him for myself as a son. I will be his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will establish his kingdom forever, if he is committed to keeping my commandments and my ordinances, as is happening today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the sight of all Israel, the assembly of the Lord, and in the hearing of our God, keep and seek out all the commandments of the Lord your God so that you may possess the good land and live in it as an inheritance for your children after you, forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, Solomon, my son, know the God of your father, and serve him with a whole heart and with a willing mind because the Lord searches all hearts. He understands every thought people plan. If you seek him, he will let you find him. If you forsake him, he will cast you off forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider this carefully! Because the Lord has chosen you to build a house for the holy place, be strong and do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David gave his son Solomon the plan for the porch, its buildings, its storage rooms, its upper rooms, its inner chambers, and the chamber for the atonement seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also gave him the plans for everything he had in mind for the courtyard of the House of the Lord, for all the chambers around it, for the storage rooms, and for the storage rooms for the dedicated gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave the plans for the divisions of the priests and Levites, for all the work of service of the House of the Lord, and the designs for all the vessels and utensils for the service of the House of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He prescribed the weight of the gold for all the vessels for every kind of service and the weight of the silver for all the vessels for every kind of service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This included the weight of the gold for each gold lampstand and its lamps, the weight of the silver for the silver lampstands and their lamps according to the prescribed use of each lampstand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the weight of gold for each table for the bread that is arranged, the silver for the silver tables,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the weight for the meat hooks, the sprinkling bowls, the pure gold pitchers, the weight for each gold bowl, the weight of silver for each small silver bowl,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the weight of refined gold for the altar of incense, and the plan for the chariot for the gold cherubim who are spreading their wings and covering the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said, “All this is in writing. Because the hand of the Lord was on me, he made clear all the specifications involved in the plan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to Solomon his son, “Be strong and be courageous and do this. Do not fear and do not be overwhelmed, because the Lord God, my God, is with you. He will not fail you. He will not forsake you while all the work for the service for the House of the Lord is being finished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, the divisions of the priests and the Levites have been designated for all the service in the house of God. With you in all this work is every willing man, skilled for every form of service, the officials, and all the people who are ready for all your directions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
King David said this to the whole assembly:
My son Solomon, the one God has chosen, is young and inexperienced. The work is great because this citadel is not for a man. It is for the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to all my strength, I have provided these things for the house of my God: gold for the gold items, silver for the silver, bronze for the bronze, iron for the iron, wood for the wooden, onyx stones and settings, antimony, stones of many different colors, every kind of precious stone, and alabaster in abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of my devotion to the house of my God, from my personal treasure of gold and silver I am also giving for the house of my God in addition to all that I have already provided for this holy house:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: three thousand talents of gold from Ophir and seven thousand talents of refined silver for overlaying the walls of the structures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given gold for gold items and silver for silver items for all the work by the craftsmen. Who else is willing to dedicate himself to the Lord today?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officials of fathers’ houses, the officials of the tribes of Israel, and the officers of the thousands and of the hundreds made their offerings to the officials who were in charge of the king’s work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave for the service of the house of God five thousand talents and ten thousand darics of gold, ten thousand talents of silver, eighteen thousand talents of bronze, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who possessed stones gave them to the treasury of the House of the Lord, which was under the control of Jehiel the Gershonite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people rejoiced over their willing giving, since with an undivided heart they had offered freely to the Lord. King David also was very joyful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David blessed the Lord in the presence of the entire assembly. He said:
Blessed are you, Lord, the God of Israel, our father, from eternity to eternity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To you, O Lord, belong greatness, power, glory, victory, and majesty, because everything in the heavens and on the earth belongs to you. You, Lord, are exalted as head above everything. The kingdom belongs to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Riches and honor come from you. You are ruling over everything. In your hand are power and strength. It is in your power to make anyone great and strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, our God, we are thanking you and praising your glorious name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who am I? Who are my people that we are able to offer willingly like this? For everything comes from you. What we have given to you came from your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are aliens and temporary residents before you, as were all our fathers. Our days on the earth are like a shadow, and there is no hope of staying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, our God, all this abundance, which we have provided for building a house for you, for your holy name, is from your hand. This abundance belongs to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know, my God, that you test the heart, and you take pleasure in uprightness. In the uprightness of my heart I have freely offered all these things. Now with joy I see your people, who are present here to bring the offering freely to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, the God of our fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, preserve forever this purpose and way of thinking in the heart of your people. Direct their heart to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To my son Solomon, give an undivided heart to keep your commandments, your testimonies, and your statutes, to do everything needed to build the citadel for which I have made preparations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to the whole assembly, “Now bless the Lord your God.” So all the assembly blessed the Lord, the God of their fathers. They bowed and stretched out flat on the ground before the Lord and the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They offered sacrifices to the Lord. On the next day they offered burnt offerings to the Lord (one thousand bulls, one thousand rams, one thousand lambs), their drink offerings, and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ate and drank before the Lord on that day with great joy. They made Solomon, the son of David, king a second time. They anointed him as the ruler for the Lord and Zadok as the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon sat on the throne of the Lord as king in the place of David his father. He prospered, and all Israel obeyed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the officials, the strong warriors, and also all the sons of King David pledged loyalty to Solomon the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord made Solomon extremely great in the presence of all Israel. He gave him kingly majesty, such as had not been bestowed upon any king before him in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David son of Jesse had been king over all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was king over Israel for forty years, in Hebron for seven years and in Jerusalem for thirty-three years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He died at a good age, full of days, riches, and honor. Then Solomon his son reigned as king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The acts of King David from first to last are written in the records of Samuel the seer, the records of Nathan the prophet, and the records of Gad the seer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: including everything about his kingship, his mighty deeds, and the events that happened during his time, to him, to Israel, and to the kingdoms of the other lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator
